meanings.definition: A person to whom secrets or private matters are confided.
meanings.sent1: My sister is my confidante, and I tell her everything.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the confidante of the group, always keeping our secrets safe.
meanings.sent3: The cat became my confidante after I whispered my secrets to her.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood as a silent confidante, listening to the whispers of the wind.
meanings.sent5: In the world of spies, a confidante can be a dangerous ally if they betray your trust.

meanings.definition: A close friend or companion with whom one shares personal and private information.
meanings.sent1: My best friend is my confidante, and I trust her with all my secrets.
meanings.sent2: As a confidante, she always knows how to cheer me up when I'm feeling down.
meanings.sent3: The confidante in the movie turned out to be the unexpected hero in the end.
meanings.sent4: Her diary became her confidante, holding all her innermost thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent5: A loyal confidante is like a treasure chest, holding all your secrets safe and sound.
